# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

To create the `wrap_string` function according to your requirements, here's the code:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text)
    
    wrapped_text = ""
    for i in 1:length(words)
        word = words[i]
        
        # Check if the word fits in the current line or exceeds width
        new_line = (i == length(words)) || (length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width)
        
        # Add the word to the wrapped_text, adding a newline if necessary
        wrapped_text *= word * (new_line ? "\n" : ""))
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a test. It should wrap with each line reaching maximum 10 characterså®½."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function, `wrap_string`, iterates over the words in the given text. If any word exceeds the specified `text_width` limit, it adds a new line to the wrapped text. The example usage demonstrates how to call this function with a sample text.
